ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates how to place the trading annotations, that are commonly used in trading and financial applications over a chart by click in realtime as well as in code-behind.
The Trading annotations are created via TradingAnnotationCreationModifier, or with TradingAnnotationCreationModifierMvvm in MVVM. TradingAnnotationCreationModifier is derived from AnnotationsBase.
You can find more information on this, following this links:
- [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/Editing%20and%20Interacting%20with%20Annotations.html']AnnotationCreationModifier[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/MVVM%20Annotations%20API.html']MVVM Annotations API[/url]
In order to create the annotation in code-behind or in ViewModel you will use method SetBasePoint (IComparable x, IComparable y).
[b]Annotation Types Include:[/b]
- [url='link?']AxisMarkerAnnotation[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/Freedraw%20(Brush)%20Drawing%20Tool.html']BrushAnnotation[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/Elliot%20Wave%20Drawing%20Tool.html']ElliotWaveAnnotation[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/XABCD%20(Gartley%20or%20Harmonic)%20Drawing%20Tool.html']XabcdAnnotation[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/Head%20%26%20Shoulders%20Drawing%20Tool.html']HeadAndShouldersAnnotation[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/Fibonacci%20Retracement%20Drawing%20Tool.html']FibonacciRetracementAnnotation[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/Fibonacci%20Extension%20Drawing%20Tool.html']FibonacciExtensionAnnotation[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/Pitchfork%20Drawing%20Tool.html']PitchforkAnnotation[/url]
Also you can find more info about TradingAnnotationCreation modifier, following this links:
- [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/TradingAnnotationCreationModifier.html']TradingAnnotationCreationModifier[/url]
You can change styling of the annotations by changing the annotation properties such as line color and thickness, as well as fill color.
